TEXT:  
Heat saucepan over medium heat. Add the ground beef and sear until the juices come out. Add onions garlic and green pepper. Stir well until the meat is browned and the onions are soft. Add diced tomatoes tomato sauce beans chili powder and basil to the mixture. Add salt and pepper according to the indicated quantity or according to your own taste. When the mixture boils turn down the heat and simmer for around 20 minutes. And that's it. Quick and easy right. Now place your chili in big serving bowl top with green onions red bell pepper sour cream or cheese if desired. The above recipe has a relatively mild non-spicy taste perfect for people who are sensitive to spicy food. For a spicier version throw in some sliced jalapeno pepper into the mixture while it is simmering.

Here are the ACTIONS for the provided TEXT:

**Prepare the grill. Cook the peppers on the grill and give the skin a little charring. After which place them on a closed container and let it steam out the skin. After 10 minutes peel the skin off easily. Slice the peppers in half and take the seeds and stem out. Next chop the succulent parts and set it aside. To make the croutons slice the bread into 2-inch squares. Drizzle olive oil over it and season with salt and pepper. Get the pieces toasting in the oven for 10 minutes turning them over halfway. In a mixing bowl whisk together 1/2 cup of olive oil, wine vinegar, herbs, anchovy sauce, onion, cucumber, tomatoes, and garlic. Add the cooked peppers and season it. Take croutons and toss it with the vegetables. Top it with the mozzarella cheese and serve.**

Here are the **extracted ACTIONS** from your last given TEXT:

**TEXT:**  
How to make scrambled eggs in the microwave. First get a mug or small bowl any microwave-safe mug or bowl will work fine. Dip a paper towel in a little bit of vegetable or olive oil and smear the oil around the inside of the bowl. You could also spray the mug or bowl with non-stick cooking spray. Break the egg directly into the bowl. Beat together the eggs and milk in a microwave-proof bowl. Season with a little freshly ground black pepper salt and stir mixed until the mixture is pale yellow and smooth. Cook uncovered in the microwave on high for 1 minute. Remove and stir with a fork. Stir the mixture to fluff up the eggs. Add a tablespoon of shredded cheese a small handful of scallions or another topping if you'd like. Return and cook for 30 seconds before mixing again, the eggs should be just soft. Serve immediately with the herbs bread.

---

**ACTIONS:**

- get (mug, bowl)
- Dip (paper towel, oil)
- smear (oil, bowl)

- Beat (eggs, milk, bowl)

- fluff (eggs)

Here are the ACTIONS extracted from your provided TEXT on making iced espresso:

---

**TEXT:**
Just use cold milk. Iced Espresso is very simple to prepare and it requires only a few minutes. Follow the steps mentioned below to make iced espresso in ten minutes or less. Fresh ground-coffee enough to fill in the portafilter. Compress the ground espresso in the machine's porta filter using a camper. Make sure the entire contents of the espresso are ground well. Brush aside the remains spilled out on the filter rim and then attach the filter to the machine. Make sure that the filter and the pockets align well sealing them together tightly. Place the espresso cup beneath and prepare an espresso shot using the machine's guidelines. Besides prepare a large glass with two-thirds of ice. Pour the prepared espresso shot over the ice. Now fill the large glass with milk. You can top the iced espresso with any flavored syrup of preferred taste and stir for the contents to blend well. Add toppings such as cinnamon whipped cream nutmeg chocolate caramel etc. Make exciting drinks by including flavored syrups. Enjoy the drink. Depending on the espresso machine one can prepare either a single double shot iced espresso. To prepare a double shot espresso in a dual filter place 2 espresso cups under the two spouts and repeat the procedure above. In case you are having a single shot espresso machine just repeat the procedure twice to get a double shot espresso. Usually a good espresso shot takes around 20-22 minutes. If your shot takes much shorter or longer adjust the amount of tamping pressure. You can also use chocolate to prepare iced mocha. If chocolate does not blend well then mix it with espresso and then add ice.

---

**ACTIONS:**

- use(milk)
- prepare(iced espresso)
- follow(steps)
- make(iced espresso)
- fill(portafilter, ground-coffee)
- compress(ground espresso, portafilter)
- brush(remains, filter rim)
- attach(filter, machine)
- align(filter, pockets)
- seal(filter, pockets)
- place(cup, beneath(spout))
- prepare(espresso shot, machine)
- prepare(glass, ice)
- pour(espresso shot, ice)
- fill(glass, milk)
- top(iced espresso, flavored syrup)
- stir(contents)
- add(toppings)
- include(flavored syrups)
- enjoy(drink)
- prepare(single/double shot, iced espresso)
- place(cups, spouts)
- repeat(procedure)
- adjust(tamping pressure)
- use(chocolate, iced mocha)
- mix(chocolate, espresso)
- add(ice)

---

- add(Castile soap, baking soda, pan)

- clean(pan)
- help(clean, pan)

- work(Castile soap, baking soda, orange essential oil, paste)
- form(paste)
- remove(spots)

**Expanded explanation:**

- Add a little Castile soap and baking soda to the pan → `add(Castile soap, baking soda, pan)`
- Use a scrub sponge to remove any burned on spots → `use(scrub sponge, remove, burned spots)`
- Castile soap...will help clean the pan → `help(clean, pan)` or `clean(pan)`
- Orange essential oil ... will help loosen up ... foods and grease → `help(loosen, foods, grease)`
- The baking soda will work with the Castile soap and orange essential oil ... to form ... paste → `work(Castile soap, baking soda, orange essential oil, paste)` and `form(paste)`
- remove any burned on spots → `remove(spots)`
